item.title: Road drain completely blocked, 26th February
item.description:
Road drain is blocked full with mud. Historically, this is an area prone to flooding resulting from sudden downpours. This adds to the significance of this drain blockage. The drain has been blocked for over two weeks and even after light rain the roadside accumulates a significant amount of standing water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Greenway Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light STILL out!, 26th February
item.description:
This problem has been reported repeatedly and it is still yet to be fixed, the streetlight next to the garages in Selkirk close is broken and never turns on. This leaves the road very very dark. the road is used as through road for walkers including school children its very unsafe for it to be left so dark for so long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7-12, Selkirk Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping West end carpark, 26th February
item.description:
Massive pile of bin bags in West End carpark just off lower High St. regular occurrence here. Is the shop paying for enough bins/ collections? Is there adequate bin storage for the flats above the shop?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Poole Way, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road sign is giving the wrong information about lane choice, 26th February
item.description:
Heading south from Bishops Cleeve on the A435, through the current road works, approaching the Kayte Lane lights, the arrow road markings are suggesting that to go ahead to Cheltenham, we should be in the right lane, and to go left we move into the left lane. This is incorrect: the right lane is a right turn only lane towards Swindon Village, and the left lane(s) are for going ahead or turn left to Southam. My Learner Drivers are following the road markings, and either then going the wrong way, or potentially changing lanes on approach to traffic signals, without checking for safety, and warning others of their intended plan. I believe the main stem of the main arrow should be slanted left to about “ ‘10.30am” orientation, and the right turn stem should be pointing towards the right lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 26th February
item.description:
there is a trench /pot hole that is the width of the road.the only way you can avoid this is by driving on the other side of the road.this is dangerous to drivers and cyclists,this needs serious attention before there is an accident.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire length of Whittington Road is riddled with Potholes, 26th February
item.description:
These potholes have been reported for at least 2 years . They are patched up and the re appear after a few weeks..None of the debris is cleared up . As you can see from the photos of outside 41 Whittington Road it is a mess . This applies to the whole length of Whittington Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 26th February
item.description:
Benhall Avenue is deteriorating particularly near the junction with Miserden Road. I am just enquiring whether there is any works planned to be done to rectify the deterioration here soon? It's got to the point where I am having to use different routes to get around using this section of carriageway to avoid damaging my car.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple signs and barriers left on road along Kayte lane, 26th February
item.description:
There are numerous barriers signs and sandbags left along Kayte lane from where the road has been closed due to flooding. Many of these are close to the raod edge and pose a risk as the road is narrow and unlit
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kayte Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
